CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Investment Bank, European Investment Fund, European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: BI301

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: ЕИБ - ЕИБ - Програма за техническа помощ за Инструмента за микрофинансиране и действия в подкрепа на финансовото включване на повече уязвими лица в Южното съседство на ЕС
EIB - EIB - Program technické pomoci pro nástroj mikrofinancování a pro opatření na podporu finančního začlenění zranitelnějších skupin obyvatelstva v zemích jižního sousedství EU
EIB - EIB - Teknisk bistandsprogram vedrørende mikrofinansieringsfacilitet og tiltag til støtte for finansiel inklusion af mere sårbare mennesker i EU’s sydlige naboskabsområde

EIB - EIB - Programm für technische Hilfe für die Mikrofinanzfazilität und für Maßnahmen zur Förderung der finanziellen Inklusion besonders schutzbedürftiger Personen in den Ländern der südlichen Nachbarschaft der EU

ΕΤΕπ - ΕΤΕπ - Πρόγραμμα τεχνικής βοήθειας προς τον Μηχανισμό Μικροχρηματοδοτήσεων και δράσεις για τη στήριξη της χρηματοπιστωτικής ένταξης των περισσότερο ευάλωτων προσώπων στις χώρες της νότιας γειτονίας της ΕΕ
EIB - EIB - Technical assistance programme to Microfinance Facility and actions supporting the financial inclusion of more vulnerable persons in the Southern Neighbourhood of the EU

BEI - BEI - Programa de asistencia técnica para el Instrumento de Microfinanciación y acciones en apoyo de la inclusión financiera de las personas más vulnerables en los países vecinos meridionales de la UE
EIP - EIP - Tehnilise abi programm mikrofinantseerimise rahastu ja tegevuste jaoks, millega toetatakse haavatavamate isikute finantsalast kaasamist ELi lõunanaabruskonnas
EIP - EIP - Mikrorahoitusjärjestelyä ja heikommassa asemassa olevien henkilöiden taloudellista osallisuutta tukevia toimia EU:n eteläisissä naapurimaissa koskeva teknisen avun ohjelma

BEI - BEI - Programme d’assistance technique en faveur du Mécanisme de microfinance et d’actions soutenant l’inclusion financière de personnes particulièrement vulnérables dans les pays voisins du Sud de l’UE
BEI - BEI - Technical assistance programme to Microfinance Facility and actions supporting the financial inclusion of more vulnerable persons in the Southern Neighbourhood of the EU
EIB - EIB - Program tehničke pomoći za Mikrofinancijski instrument i djelovanja za podršku financijskom uključivanju ranjivijih osoba u južnom susjedstvu EU-a

EBB - EBB - Technikai segítségnyújtási program a mikrofinanszírozási eszközhöz, valamint az EU deli szomszédos országaiban élő kiszolgáltatottabb személyek pénzügyi integrációját támogató intézkedések
BEI - BEI - Programma di assistenza tecnica allo Strumento di Microfinanza e azioni a sostegno dell'inclusione finanziaria delle persone più vulnerabili nei Paesi del vicinato meridionale dell'UE
EIB - EIB - Techninės pagalbos programa, skirta mikrofinansų priemonei ir veiksmams, kuriais remiama labiau pažeidžiamų asmenų ES pietinėse kaimyninėse šalyse finansinė įtrauktis
EIB - EIB - Tehniskās palīdzības programma mikrofinansēšanas instrumentam un darbības, ar ko atbalsta neaizsargātāku personu finansiālo integrāciju ES dienvidu kaimiņreģionā
BEI - BEI - Programm ta’ għajnuna teknika lill-Faċilità tal-Mikrofinanzi u azzjonijiet li jappoġġjaw l-inklużjoni finanzjarja ta’ persuni l-aktar vulnerabbli fil-Madwar tan- Nofsinhar tal-UE

EIB - EIB - Programma voor technische bijstand bij de microfinancieringsfaciliteit en bij werkzaamheden ter ondersteuning van financiële insluiting van kwetsbaardere personen in het zuidelijke nabuurschap van de EU

EBI - EBI - Program pomocy technicznej na rzecz instrumentu mikrofinansowania i działań wspierających włączenie społeczne pod względem finansowym osób bardziej narażonych w państwach południowego sąsiedztwa UE
BEI - BEI - Programa de assistência técnica ao Instrumento de Microfinanciamento e ações de apoio à inclusão financeira de pessoas mais vulneráveis na Vizinhança Meridional da UE
BEI - BEI - Program de asistență tehnică pentru instrumentul de microfinanțare și acțiuni de susținere a incluziunii financiare a persoanelor mai vulnerabile din vecinătatea sudică a UE
EIB - EIB - Program technickej pomoci pre nástroj mikrofinancovania a akcie na podporu finančného začlenenia zraniteľnejších osôb v južnom susedstve EÚ
EIB - EIB - Program tehnične pomoči za mikrofinančni instrument in ukrepe, ki podpirajo finančno vključevanje ranljivejših oseb v državah južnega sosedstva EU
EIB - EIB - Tekniskt biståndsprogram till instrumentet för mikrokrediter och åtgärder som stöder finansiell integrering av fler sårbara personer i EU:s södra grannskap

TI_DOC.P: EIB - EIB - Technical assistance programme to Microfinance Facility and actions supporting the financial inclusion of more vulnerable persons in the Southern Neighbourhood of the EU (LU-Luxembourg)

TXT_MARK.P: TA2016069 R0 FTF
Restricted international tender
FEMIP Trust Fund
FEMIP Trust Fund
Fee-based

In the framework of the Risk Capital Facility for the Southern Neighbourhood countries, financed by the EIB and the European Commission (from the general budget of the European Union under the Neighbourhood Investment Facility), the Bank launched the Southern Neighbourhood Microfinance Facility ("SNMF or the Facility"), to realise small microfinance investments in the Southern Neighbourhood of the European Union (the "Region").

The overall objective of this TA operation is to promote the financial inclusion of more vulnerable persons including youth, the unemployed, migrants and refugees. The aim is to improve the quantity and quality of financial and non-financial services for vulnerable populations currently unserved or underserved by the traditional or inclusive financial sector to help improve their economic well-being and contribute to regional stability.

The specific objective of this Technical Assistance operation is to encourage Financial Intermediaries to provide responsible financial and non-financial services to vulnerable populations via the following components:

i) Component 1: Support current and/or potential Financial Intermediaries willing to explore the feasibility of expanding activities or consolidating existing activities to more vulnerable persons and in particular to migrants and refugees.

ii) Component 2: Support the provision of financial education, financial literacy, vocational training, economic empowerment and technical support for more vulnerable persons such as youth, unemployed as well as migrants and refugees.

A team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialized in microfinance, product diversification (ideally with experience of developing financial and non-financial products for the inclusion of vulnerable populations), social performance, non-financial services and business development with experience in similar kinds of assignments shall implement the aforementioned components.
The Contractor will also be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The Project will be headed up from the Region (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years.

In parallel to this tender, the EIB will also be launching a TA Programme entitled “Technical Assistance Programme to Microfinance Facility and actions supporting the financial inclusion in the Southern Neighbourhood of the EU”. Cooperation between the 2 TA programmes is expected.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: March 2018
None

Regulation (EC) no 1638/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24.10.2006 laying down general provisions establishing a European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument, the ECOFIN Council Decision of 26.11.2003 mandating the European Investment Bank to establish a Trust Fund and the European Investment Bank Board of Directors decision of 14.10.2004 on the establishment of the FEMIP Trust Fund.

In the framework of the Risk Capital Facility for the Southern Neighbourhood countries, financed by the EIB and the European Commission (from the general budget of the European Union under the Neighbourhood Investment Facility), the Bank launched the Southern Neighbourhood Microfinance Facility ("SNMF or the Facility"), to realise small microfinance investments in the Southern Neighbourhood of the European Union (the "Region").

The overall objective of this TA operation is to promote the financial inclusion of more vulnerable persons including youth, the unemployed, migrants and refugees. The aim is to improve the quantity and quality of financial and non-financial services for vulnerable populations currently unserved or underserved by the traditional or inclusive financial sector to help improve their economic well-being and contribute to regional stability.

The specific objective of this Technical Assistance operation is to encourage Financial Intermediaries to provide responsible financial and non-financial services to vulnerable populations via the following components:

i) Component 1: Support current and/or potential Financial Intermediaries willing to explore the feasibility of expanding activities or consolidating existing activities to more vulnerable persons and in particular to migrants and refugees.

ii) Component 2: Support the provision of financial education, financial literacy, vocational training, economic empowerment and technical support for more vulnerable persons such as youth, unemployed as well as migrants and refugees.

A team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialized in microfinance, product diversification (ideally with experience of developing financial and non-financial products for the inclusion of vulnerable populations), social performance, non-financial services and business development with experience in similar kinds of assignments shall implement the aforementioned components.
The Contractor will also be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The Project will be headed up from the Region (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years.

In parallel to this tender, the EIB will also be launching a TA Programme entitled “Technical Assistance Programme to Microfinance Facility and actions supporting the financial inclusion in the Southern Neighbourhood of the EU”. Cooperation between the 2 TA programmes is expected.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: March 2018
None

Regulation (EC) no 1638/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24.10.2006 laying down general provisions establishing a European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument, the ECOFIN Council Decision of 26.11.2003 mandating the European Investment Bank to establish a Trust Fund and the European Investment Bank Board of Directors decision of 14.10.2004 on the establishment of the FEMIP Trust Fund.

ii) Component 2: Support the provision of financial education, financial literacy, vocational training, economic empowerment and technical support for more vulnerable persons such as youth, unemployed as well as migrants and refugees.

A team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialized in microfinance, product diversification (ideally with experience of developing financial and non-financial products for the inclusion of vulnerable populations), social performance, non-financial services and business development with experience in similar kinds of assignments shall implement the aforementioned components.
The Contractor will also be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The Project will be headed up from the Region (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years.

Restricted international tender
FEMIP Trust Fund
FEMIP Trust Fund
Fee-based

In the framework of the Risk Capital Facility for the Southern Neighbourhood countries, financed by the EIB and the European Commission (from the general budget of the European Union under the Neighbourhood Investment Facility), the Bank launched the Southern Neighbourhood Microfinance Facility ("SNMF or the Facility"), to realise small microfinance investments in the Southern Neighbourhood of the European Union (the "Region").

The overall objective of this TA operation is to promote the financial inclusion of more vulnerable persons including youth, the unemployed, migrants and refugees. The aim is to improve the quantity and quality of financial and non-financial services for vulnerable populations currently unserved or underserved by the traditional or inclusive financial sector to help improve their economic well-being and contribute to regional stability.

The specific objective of this Technical Assistance operation is to encourage Financial Intermediaries to provide responsible financial and non-financial services to vulnerable populations via the following components:

i) Component 1: Support current and/or potential Financial Intermediaries willing to explore the feasibility of expanding activities or consolidating existing activities to more vulnerable persons and in particular to migrants and refugees.

ii) Component 2: Support the provision of financial education, financial literacy, vocational training, economic empowerment and technical support for more vulnerable persons such as youth, unemployed as well as migrants and refugees.

A team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialized in microfinance, product diversification (ideally with experience of developing financial and non-financial products for the inclusion of vulnerable populations), social performance, non-financial services and business development with experience in similar kinds of assignments shall implement the aforementioned components.
The Contractor will also be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The Project will be headed up from the Region (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years.

In parallel to this tender, the EIB will also be launching a TA Programme entitled “Technical Assistance Programme to Microfinance Facility and actions supporting the financial inclusion in the Southern Neighbourhood of the EU”. Cooperation between the 2 TA programmes is expected.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: March 2018
None

Regulation (EC) no 1638/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24.10.2006 laying down general provisions establishing a European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument, the ECOFIN Council Decision of 26.11.2003 mandating the European Investment Bank to establish a Trust Fund and the European Investment Bank Board of Directors decision of 14.10.2004 on the establishment of the FEMIP Trust Fund.
